A Psalm of David, when he was in the wilderness of Judah. O God, thou <FI>art<Fi> my God; early will I seek thee: my soul thirsteth for thee, my flesh longeth for thee in a dry and thirsty land, where no water is;<RF>thirsty: Heb. weary<Rf><RF>where…: without water<Rf>
To see thy power and thy glory, so <FI>as<Fi> I have seen thee in the sanctuary.<CM>
Because thy lovingkindness <FI>is<Fi> better than life, my lips shall praise thee.
Thus will I bless thee while I live: I will lift up my hands in thy name.
My soul shall be satisfied as <FI>with<Fi> marrow and fatness; and my mouth shall praise <FI>thee<Fi> with joyful lips:<RF>marrow: Heb. fatness<Rf>
When I remember thee upon my bed, <FI>and<Fi> meditate on thee in the <FI>night<Fi> watches.<CM>
Because thou hast been my help, therefore in the shadow of thy wings will I rejoice.
My soul followeth hard after thee: thy right hand upholdeth me.
But those <FI>that<Fi> seek my soul, to destroy <FI>it<Fi>, shall go into the lower parts of the earth.
They shall fall by the sword: they shall be a portion for foxes.<RF>They shall fall…: Heb. They shall make him run out like water by the hands of<Rf>
But the king shall rejoice in God; every one that sweareth by him shall glory: but the mouth of them that speak lies shall be stopped.<CM>
